qas.question: Who is responsible for policing Southampton?
How much did it cost to build the operations base of Southampton's police service?
On what street in Southampton is the police headquarters for the city?
What year did the brand new, eight-story police headquarters open?
What train station is close to the police force's building?

context: Southampton's police service is provided by <a0_0>Hampshire Constabulary<a0_0/>. The main base of the Southampton operation is a new, eight storey purpose-built building which cost <a1_0>£30 million<a1_0/> to construct. The building, located on <a2_0>Southern Road<a2_0/>, opened in <a3_0>2011<a3_0/> and is near to <a4_0>Southampton Central<a4_0/> railway station. Previously, the central Southampton operation was located within the west wing of the Civic Centre, however the ageing facilities and the plans of constructing a new museum in the old police station and magistrates court necessitated the move. There are additional police stations at Portswood, Banister Park, Bitterne, and Shirley as well as a British Transport Police station at Southampton Central railway station.
